# Global inputs
Creates a global "Input" variable for use in other scripts, allowing users to enter any number

# Use
Requires the "Headquarters" to be open (to avoid conflicts with other scripts)
The "1" key will raise the input variable's decimal position defined using "3" and "4" by 1
The "2" key will lower the input variable's decimal position defined using "3" and "4" by 2
The "3" key will change the decimal position by +1 i.e. ones to tens
The "4" key will change the decimal position by -1 i.e. tens to ones

The default decimal position is 0 = ones

An example usage would be to press 1 5 times to raise the "ones" position to 5, then press 3 twice to change the decimal position from "ones" to "hundreds", then press 1 twice to raise the "hundreds" position to 2.
The resulting "Input" variable will be 205

# Requirements
The code is 3 scripts with a maximum 11 lines. The scripts can be viewed in the individual files as code with comments.

# Import
All three scripts:
`;;`
